messages.subject: Re: My first post
messages.msgSnippet: ... And it continues into adulthood with are you making enough money? do you have the right job?  do you have the right car? etc. Instead of pursuing
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., "miaathomew2" <mia.goodall@f...>
wrote:

> I feel like in this society we are so focused on if are kids are
> reading well, doing math etc. that we forget to see how are they
> feeling , are they happy etc.


And it continues into adulthood with are you making enough money? do
you have the 'right' job? do you have the 'right car? etc.

Instead of pursuing happiness, we seem to be pursuing stuff.

Bridget

Welcome Mia. Your grammar and spelling is as good as many of the people on

Tia, a native Californian transplanted to Canada

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] My first post
messages.messageBody:
<< I espacially love your view on unschooling Sandra. >>

Thank you.

<<I believe that if children are in a loving, free ,trusting
enviroment learning happens naturally. >>

What languages are your children speaking?

An American friend of mine married a Swede and moved there. I love hearing
the language difference stories. She goes to language school for immigrants.

Sandra

messages.subject: My first post
messages.msgSnippet: I have been enjoying reading a lot of the posts and I am learning so much. I espacially love your view on unschooling Sandra. I heard some body ones said that
messages.messageBody:
I have been enjoying reading a lot of the posts and I am learning so
much.
I espacially love your view on unschooling Sandra.
I heard some body ones said that "education is not the most
important thing for a child"
I feel like in this society we are so focused on if are kids are
reading well, doing math etc. that we forget to see how are they
feeling , are they happy etc.
You really nailed it for me Sandra when you said your kids never
ever go to sleep crying, how you focused on their happiness.
I believe that if children are in a loving, free ,trusting
enviroment learning happens naturally.

Forgive my grammar and spelling mistakes.
English is my third language.

A swedish/Finish Canadian

Mia
